title: 108_hr1399
content:
The Act titled "Black Canyon of the Gunnison National Park and Gunnison Gorge National Conservation Area Boundary Revision Act of 2003" is about revising the boundary of Black Canyon of the Gunnison National Park. The Black Canyon of the Gunnison National Park boundary is revised to include up to 2,725 acres as depicted on a specific map. Additionally, there are amendments regarding land transfer administration. The Black Canyon of the Gunnison National Park boundary is revised to include 2,725 acres as shown on a map. The Secretary will transfer Tract C from the Bureau of Land Management to the National Park Service for inclusion in the Park. SEC. 3. Grazing privileges at Black Canyon of the Gunnison National Park are addressed. Section 4(e) of the Black Canyon of the Gunnison National Park and Gunnison Gorge National Conservation Area Act of 1999 is amended to address the transfer of grazing privileges when land authorized for grazing is exchanged for private land under the Act. The Black Canyon of the Gunnison National Park and Gunnison Gorge National Conservation Area Act of 1999 is amended to address the transfer of grazing privileges for specific partnerships and corporations. The Black Canyon of the Gunnison National Park and Gunnison Gorge National Conservation Area Act of 1999 is amended to address the transfer of grazing privileges for specific partnerships and corporations, including subparagraphs (A), (B), or (C). SEC. 4. ACQUISITION OF LAND.

(a) Authority to Acquire Land.--Amends the Black Canyon of the Gunnison National Park and Gunnison Gorge National Conservation Area Act of 1999 to allow acquisition of land based on a specified map.
(b) Method of Acquisition.--Specifies that land acquisition must comply with the Act and requires consent of the landowner.

SEC. 5. GUNNISON GORGE NATIONAL CONSERVATION AREA BOUNDARY REVISION. SEC. 5. Gunnison Gorge National Conservation Area boundary is revised to include up to 7,100 acres as depicted on a specific map. SEC. 6. The Commissioner of Reclamation retains jurisdiction over land, facilities, and roads in specific areas for maintenance, repair, and operation of water delivery facilities under the Bureau of Reclamation.
